chart.title: Freshwater withdrawals as a share of internal resources
chart.subtitle: Freshwater withdrawals refer to total water withdrawals from agriculture, industry and municipal/domestic uses. Withdrawals can exceed 100% of total renewable resources where extraction from non-renewable aquifers or desalination plants is considerable.
chart.note: Five classes have been identified to signal different levels of stress on water sources: <25%: _no stress_, 25-50%: _low stress_, 50-75%: _medium stress_, 75-100%: _high stress_ and >100%: _critical stress_.
chart.citation: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations
